author: Matthew Seeman
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Today is going to be the best day of the week! Sunny skies and highs in the low to mid 60s are on tap for this Thursday, but a weather maker currently over the Pacific Ocean will push clouds into the area tomorrow. As that system continues to move eastward, there is a slight chance for rain and mountain snow showers Saturday and Saturday night.{ }{/p}{p}As of right now it appears we will have quiet weather for New Year's Eve, but temperatures will be chilly so be sure to dress warmly if you plan to be outside on the Las Vegas strip for the festivities.{ }{/p}{p}Have a great Thursday!{/p}{p}The unemployment rate in the Las Vegas metro area dipped in November, according to new figures from state officials, in keeping with typical seasonal patterns.{/p}{p}Unemployment for the Las Vegas area was 5.1% last month, non-seasonally adjusted, per the Nevada Department of Employment, Training and Rehabilitation, or DETR.{/p}{p}That's down from a 5.4% rate reported in October and 5.8% in the year-ago month.{/p}{p}{strong}RELATED | {a href=\"https://news3lv.com/news/local/nevada-labor-force-reaches-all-time-high-in-november-detr-employment-unemployment-rate-las-vegas-reno-carson-city#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://news3lv.com/news/local/nevada-labor-force-reaches-all-time-high-in-november-detr-employment-unemployment-rate-las-vegas-reno-carson-city#\"}Nevada labor force reaches all-time high in November{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}The labor force in Las Vegas for November was 1.21 million people, nearly 9,600 more than was reported in October, DETR reported.{/p}{p}Unemployment fell in most of the state's counties in November. For Reno, the rate was 3.7%, while for Carson City the rate was 4.1%. Those are down from the rates of 4% and 4.4% reported in October, respectively.{/p}{p}Nevada still has the highest jobless rate in the nation, with a seasonally adjusted unemployment rate of 5.4%.{/p}{p}Today is going to be the best day of the week! Sunny skies and highs in the low to mid 60s are on tap for this Thursday, but a weather maker currently over the Pacific Ocean will push clouds into the area tomorrow. As that system continues to move eastward, there is a slight chance for rain and mountain snow showers Saturday and Saturday night.{ }{/p}{p}As of right now it appears we will have quiet weather for New Year's Eve, but temperatures will be chilly so be sure to dress warmly if you plan to be outside on the Las Vegas strip for the festivities.{ }{/p}{p}Have a great Thursday!{/p}{p}The unemployment rate in the Las Vegas metro area dipped in November, according to new figures from state officials, in keeping with typical seasonal patterns.{/p}{p}Unemployment for the Las Vegas area was 5.1% last month, non-seasonally adjusted, per the Nevada Department of Employment, Training and Rehabilitation, or DETR.{/p}{p}That's down from a 5.4% rate reported in October and 5.8% in the year-ago month.{/p}{p}{strong}RELATED | {a href=\"https://news3lv.com/news/local/nevada-labor-force-reaches-all-time-high-in-november-detr-employment-unemployment-rate-las-vegas-reno-carson-city#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://news3lv.com/news/local/nevada-labor-force-reaches-all-time-high-in-november-detr-employment-unemployment-rate-las-vegas-reno-carson-city#\"}Nevada labor force reaches all-time high in November{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}The labor force in Las Vegas for November was 1.21 million people, nearly 9,600 more than was reported in October, DETR reported.{/p}{p}Unemployment fell in most of the state's counties in November. For Reno, the rate was 3.7%, while for Carson City the rate was 4.1%. Those are down from the rates of 4% and 4.4% reported in October, respectively.{/p}{p}Nevada still has the highest jobless rate in the nation, with a seasonally adjusted unemployment rate of 5.4%.{/p}
